dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, wait. Thirty calendar days within every six months? What even is that, like, five days a month?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, wait. Thirty calendar days within every six months? What even is that, like, five days a month?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, it's for Morocco. The new visa-free agreement for Kazakhstani travelers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, it's for Morocco. The new visa-free agreement for Kazakhstani travelers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Kazakhstan, a visa-free agreement with the Kingdom of Morocco will take effect on March 19, while visa-free entry to Montenegro and the Sultanate of Oman has been extended.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Morocco? Really? Who's, like, planning a trip for five days a month? That sounds incredibly restrictive, not "visa-free opportunities."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Morocco? Really? Who's, like, planning a trip for five days a month? That sounds incredibly restrictive, not visa-free opportunities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's not five days a month. It's thirty days total within a six-month period. You could, like, do one month-long trip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's not five days a month. It's thirty days total within a six-month period. You could, like, do one month-long trip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under this agreement, citizens of both countries holding national passports can stay in the other country for up to 30 calendar days within every six months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A month-long trip? For what? To "explore history" and "cultural exchanges" that they mention? Sounds like pure PR fluff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A month-long trip? For what? To explore history and cultural exchanges that they mention? Sounds like pure P R fluff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, it also covers business, you know? And it's not just Morocco. Montenegro's visa-free regime got extended too, until late 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, it also covers business, you know? And it's not just Morocco. Montenegro's visa-free regime got extended too, until late twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The agreement opens new opportunities for tourism, business, and cultural exchanges," the ministry stated. Another positive update comes from Montenegro, where authorities have extended the visa-free regime for Kazakhstani citizens until December 31, 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Montenegro. Right. So, more, uh, "picturesque cities" for, what, a few weeks? Are these really "opportunities" or just, like, tiny windows?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Montenegro. Right. So, more, uh, picturesque cities for, what, a few weeks? Are these really opportunities or just, like, tiny windows?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, for Oman, it's actually an increase. Kazakhstanis can now stay for up to thirty days, up from fourteen days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, for Oman, it's actually an increase. Kazakhstanis can now stay for up to thirty days, up from fourteen days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, Kazakhstanis can stay in Oman for up to 30 days, compared to the previous limit of 14 days," the ministry reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Thirty days. Whoop-de-doo. A whole two extra weeks for Oman. Is anyone actually flocking there, um, specifically because of this new fourteen-day extension?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirty days. Whoop-de-doo. A whole two extra weeks for Oman. Is anyone actually flocking there, um, specifically because of this new fourteen-day extension?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, Kazakhstanis can stay in Oman for up to 30 days, compared to the previous limit of 14 days," the ministry reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's an improvement, though, right? For tourism, for, like, short trips. It's supposed to make things easier.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's an improvement, though, right? For tourism, for, like, short trips. It's supposed to make things easier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Easier for whom, exactly? And what about the catch? Because there's always a catch. I'm guessing you can't, like, work there, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Easier for whom, exactly? And what about the catch? Because there's always a catch. I'm guessing you can't, like, work there, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, that's true. The ministry specifically says it doesn't apply to employment, education, or permanent residence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, that's true. The ministry specifically says it doesn't apply to employment, education, or permanent residence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs also emphasized that the visa-free regime does not apply to employment, education, or permanent residence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Aha! See? So it's basically just for tourists with, like, a month to kill. Not exactly opening up the world for everyone, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aha! See? So it's basically just for tourists with, like, a month to kill. Not exactly opening up the world for everyone, is it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it's, um, still more options than before, you know? For people who want to visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's, um, still more options than before, you know? For people who want to visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: More options. Sure. Very, uh, limited options. I'm not convinced this is the massive travel boom they're implying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: More options. Sure. Very, uh, limited options. I'm not convinced this is the massive travel boom they're implying.
